title: U.S. News & World Report Ranks DeVry University Advantage Academy in Top 10 of Chicago Public High Schools
description: LISLE, Ill., August 29, 2025--DeVry University Advantage Academy (DUAA) has been recognized among the top 10 Chicago Public High Schools by U.S. News & World Report.
content:
Advantage Academy ranks No. 8, empowering students to excel in higher education

LISLE, Ill., August 29, 2025--(BUSINESS WIRE)--DeVry University Advantage Academy (DUAA) has been recognized among the top 10 Chicago Public High Schools by U.S. News & World Report. This recognition highlights DeVry University’s partnership with the Chicago Public Schools and Advantage Academy’s commitment and dedication to providing students with the support they need to succeed.

"At DeVry University, we believe innovation in education is essential to fueling success for every generation of learners," said Elise Awwad, president and CEO of DeVry University. "DeVry’s Advantage Academy reflects that belief, giving Chicago Public School students the chance to graduate high school with a diploma, a college degree and a powerful head start on their future. We are proud to see our program recognized among the top ten Chicago Public High Schools and to see its city and state rankings continue to climb year after year."

"We are exceptionally proud of our educators, partners, faculty and student support staff," added Brian Niro, assistant dean, teaching and learning for DeVry University. "They have dedicated so much of themselves to providing students with the knowledge and confidence to meet–and exceed–expectations in their education and future pathways. This recognition reaffirms that commitment, and we couldn’t be prouder."

Of the top 10 high schools ranked, Advantage Academy is recognized at No. 8 on the publication’s 2025-2026 Best High Schools list out of 149. Nationally, nearly 18,000 schools were evaluated and the methodology focused on six factors: college readiness; state assessment performance; underserved student performance; college curriculum breadth; and graduation rates.

Founded in 2004, DeVry University Advantage Academy is a dual-enrollment program for qualified 11th and 12th grade students offered at no additional cost. It currently welcomes 167 students from 48 high schools, 69% of whom are from economically disadvantaged families, across the Chicago Public School system. Advantage Academy students earn their associate degrees in Information Technology and Networking with a Specialization in Network Systems Administration or an Associate Degree in Business Administration—while earning a high school diploma at the same time.

"We recognize the responsibility we have as educators to ensuring our students are prepared for their next educational journey," noted Niro. "Programs like DUAA not only accelerate education, but also break down barriers, transform futures and show our learners what is possible when they believe and dedicate themselves to their future."
summary: DeVry University Advantage Academy (DUAA) has been recognized among the top 10 Chicago Public High Schools by U.S. News & World Report. The recognition highlights DeVry University's partnership with the Chicago Public Schools and its commitment to providing students with support they need to succeed in higher education. The school is a dual-enrollment program for qualified 11th and 12th grade students and currently welcomes 167 students from 48 high schools. The publication's 2025-2026 Best High Schools list was based on six factors including college readiness, state assessment performance, insufficient student performance, college curriculum breadth, and graduation rates.
shortSummary: DeVry University Advantage Academy ranks No. 8 in U.S. News & World Report’s rankings of top Chicago Public High Schools, emphasizing its partnership with the city's schools.
argos_summary: DeVry University Advantage Academy (DUAA) has been ranked No. 8 among Chicago Public High Schools by U.S. News & World Report, highlighting its dual‑enrollment program that lets students earn both a high school diploma and an associate degree in IT or business. The program, which serves 167 students—69% from economically disadvantaged families—has seen its city and state rankings climb year over year. DUAA’s partnership with Chicago Public Schools aims to accelerate education, break down barriers, and prepare students for higher education and future careers.
